alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 18 at 8:51AM CDT until March 18 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MOBILE AND NORTHWESTERN BALDWIN COUNTIES... At 850 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of I65 And AL 225, or 7 miles east of Creola, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bay Minette, Satsuma, Creola, Stockton, Axis and I65 And AL 225. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
